intro: Pfeiffera ianthothele var. tarijensis, commonly known as the Tarijensis Pfeiffera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry climates. Its flowers are often yellow or orange, adding vibrant color to its native habitat. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging conditions.
